citations.narrative:
Some surfaces were seen to be be rough/sharp:
-Two feeders were seen to have rust that made the edges rough or sharp.
-Two pieces of metal flashing had edges dogs could contact and had sharp edges.
Rough or sharp edges could hurt dogs. Maintain all surfaces that dogs can touch free from sharp/rough/jagged edges.
***Correct by November 2, 2024.

Different areas on the inside and outside walls and divider posts were chewed and had bare wood and foam exposed that
cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized. To allow proper cleaning and sanitizing, surfaces that dogs can touch must be
maintained on a regular basis. Ensure to maintain these areas in a manner that allows them to be cleaned and sanitized.
***Correct by November 6, 2024.

It has been more than 12 months since dogs have had their head to tail physical exams. Physical exams of each dog are
required within every 12 months and help ensure each dog is healthy. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to get
the physical exams completed for each dog.
***Correct by November 22, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(1)(ii) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Some surfaces were seen to be be rough/sharp:  
-Two feeders were seen to have rust that made the edges rough or sharp.  
-Two pieces of metal flashing had edges dogs could contact and had sharp edges.  
Rough or sharp edges could hurt dogs. Maintain all surfaces that dogs can touch free from sharp/rough/jagged edges. 
***Correct by November 2, 2024. 
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Different areas on the inside and outside walls and divider posts were chewed and had bare wood and foam exposed that 
cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized. To allow proper cleaning and sanitizing, surfaces that dogs can touch must be 
maintained on a regular basis. Ensure to maintain these areas in a manner that allows them to be cleaned and sanitized.  
***Correct by November 6, 2024. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
It has been more than 12 months since dogs have had their head to tail physical exams. Physical exams of each dog are 
required within every 12 months and help ensure each dog is healthy. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to get 
the physical exams completed for each dog.  
***Correct by November 22, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
